description: Course-specific default format bundles for /word-excel-anki command. Defines which formats are most useful for each type of course.

Pharmacology.description: Drug courses benefit from all 3 formats: Word for detailed LOs, Excel for drug comparisons, Anki for memorization
Pharmacology.reasoning: Pharmacology requires memorizing drug names, classes, mechanisms, and side effects - Anki essential for recall

Pathophysiology.description: Disease mechanism courses focus on understanding rather than rote memorization
Pathophysiology.reasoning: Path emphasizes understanding disease processes, less need for flashcard memorization

Clinical Medicine.description: Clinical courses benefit from interactive HTML for quick reference during patient encounters
Clinical Medicine.reasoning: Clinical practice needs quick-access HTML format for rapid lookup during patient care

Anatomy.description: Anatomy requires memorization of structures, locations, and functions
Anatomy.reasoning: Heavy memorization component makes Anki essential; less need for comparison tables

Physiology.description: Physiology focuses on understanding systems and mechanisms
Physiology.reasoning: Understanding-focused, comparison tables help differentiate similar processes

Biochemistry.description: Biochemistry requires both understanding pathways and memorizing enzymes/reactions
Biochemistry.reasoning: Complex pathways need comparison tables, enzyme names need memorization

Microbiology.description: Microbiology requires memorizing organism names, characteristics, and treatments
Microbiology.reasoning: Organism identification and characteristics benefit from all 3 formats

Immunology.description: Immunology focuses on understanding immune mechanisms and pathways
Immunology.reasoning: Conceptual understanding primary; less memorization of discrete facts

Physical Diagnosis.description: Physical exam courses benefit from interactive HTML for clinical reference
Physical Diagnosis.reasoning: Clinical exam techniques need quick-access format for practice sessions

OSCE Prep.description: OSCE preparation uses clinical assessment guides and HTML quick reference
OSCE Prep.reasoning: Clinical scenarios require H&P guides and fast lookup formats

drugs.description: Drug content always benefits from all 3 formats regardless of course

conditions.description: Disease/condition content focuses on understanding and comparison

procedures.description: Procedural content needs step-by-step guides and quick reference

anatomy.description: Anatomical content requires memorization of structures

userOverrides.description: Users can override defaults by specifying formats in command

notes.implementation: When /word-excel-anki command is run without --formats flag, detect course type from directory path or use defaultBundle
